title: Ngā Ingoa o Aotearoa
subtitle: An oral dictionary of Māori placenames
introText: The pages of this website are not the dictionary. The audio recordings are the dictionary. The pages are just a guide to the recorded words. They are a dictionary of the pronunciations of placenames only, not their meanings. The places are sorted into "Zones", and each Zone is about the size of a county. They are divided by tribe and also along lines of convenience. To distinguish the Zones from the places, the Zones have English names, "where such have been bestowed."
disclaimerText: Just because a name has been put in a particular Zone, or is spoken by a particular person, that does not mean I claim that the place belongs to any particular people. That is not what this dictionary is for, but every name had to be assigned to somebody.
instructionsText: Choose an island to find the place name you are looking for, or use the search box at the top of this page.
copyrightText: Copyright © Hugh Young 1985, 1991 and 1994. This data may not be resold for profit. It may be copied for educational purposes. Copies should be clearly identified as such.

codelicenseText: The code used in this project is released under the GPL3 License, and is available on GitHub.
aboutText: Ngā Ingoa o Aotearoa (The Names of New Zealand) is probably the first "pronouncing dictionary" that is literally "pronouncing". The 8,200 names are spoken by 132 native speakers of Māori, chosen by each other as the best speakers for their areas.
imagemap: Click on a zone on the map to be taken to that zone (hover over the map to see the names of the zones).
name: name | names
